isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 27-SI SERIES, TYPE 200 - TROUBLESHOOTING - UNDERCHARGED BATTERY

svcproc.title: UNDERCHARGED BATTERY

note.para: The following checks must be performed before removing the alternator from the vehicle.

svcproc.para: This condition can be caused by one or more of the following conditions:

item.para: Accessories having been left on for an extended period.
Check the drive belt for proper tension.
Battery defect. If this is suspected, inspect battery as described in Group 08 - BATTERY section of the Service Manual.
Wiring defects. Check all connections for tightness and cleanliness, including the cable clamps and battery posts.
An open circuit. Connect a voltmeter from the "BAT" terminal to ground. A zero reading indicates an open between the voltmeter connection and battery.

With all accessories turned off connect a voltmeter across the battery. Operate engine at moderate speed. If voltage is 15.5 volts or more on a 12 volt system, or 31 volts or more on a 24 volt system, remove alternator for repair.

svcproc.para: If none of these conditions are found to be the problem, check the alternator as follows:

step1.para: Connect an ammeter in the circuit at the "BAT" terminal.
Turn on accessories. Connect a carbon pile across the battery.
Operate engine at moderate speed as required (usually 4000 alternator rpm or more) and adjust the carbon pile to obtain the maximum current output.

important.para: Initial voltage build-up is by residual magnetism in the rotor. Increase the speed as required to obtain maximum current output.

step1.para: If ampere output is within 10 amperes of "Rated Output" alternator is not defective.
On models equipped with the voltage adjustment cap, an adjustment of the voltage setting may correct the condition.

step2.para: Raise the setting by removing the voltage adjusting cap, rotating it in increments of 90 degrees and then reinserting the cap in the connector body.

The cap is set for medium high voltage ( Figure 3). Setting the cap (aligning the arrow) at position 2 results with a medium low regulator setting. Position "LO" is the low setting and position "HI" is the highest regulator setting.
After adjusting the setting check for an improved battery condition after a service period of reasonable length, such as one week.

note.para: The voltage adjustment in Figure 3is for purposes of illustration only. The actual adjustment may be in some other position, depending on the application requirements.

step1.para: If ampere output is not within 10 amperes of "Rated Output," insert screwdriver into end frame hole to ground the tab at the end frame ( Figure 7).

figure.caption: End Frame Test Hole and Grounding Tab

calloutgroup.callout1: A. USE SCREWDRIVER TO GROUND TAB TO END FRAME

note.para: The tag is within 3/4 in. (19 mm) of the casting surface. Do not force screwdriver deeper than 1 in. (25 mm) into the end frame.

step1.para: Operate engine at moderate speed as required and adjust carbon pile to obtain maximum current output.

If output is within 10 amperes of "Rated Output" replace regulator as covered in REPAIR PROCEDURES
.

If output is not within 10 amperes of "Rated Output" check the field winding, diode trio, rectifier bridge and stator as described in REPAIR PROCEDURES
.
Disconnect test ammeter and turn accessories off.
